NIST Trustworthy and Responsible AI NIST AI 100-2e2025 Adversarial Machine Learning A Taxonomy and Terminology of Attacks and Mitigations

This publication is a taxonomy and terminology of attacks and mitigations in adversarial machine learning, available for free from https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.AI.100-2e2025.

Key Concepts:

  • A taxonomy and terminology of attacks and mitigations in Adversarial Machine Learning.
  • The importance of Trustworthy and Responsible AI in various applications.
  • Understanding the threats and vulnerabilities associated with Adversarial Machine Learning.
  • A chapter discussing attacker capabilities and their impact on AI systems.
  • Supply chain attacks can compromise AI model integrity, requiring mitigations to prevent data poisoning and model poisoning.
  • Direct prompting attacks involve manipulating input prompts to deceive AI models, while indirect prompt injection attacks target the availability, integrity, or privacy of AI systems.
Adversarial Machine Learning Trustworthy AI Responsible AI Taxonomy Terminology Attacks Mitigations Attacker Capabilities Supply Chain Attacks Data Poisoning Attacks
